intro: Psychotria undulata, commonly known as the wavy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, wavy-edged leaves and small, clustered white or greenish-white flowers. It contains alkaloids, including psychotrimine, which have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties. Psychotria undulata is often found in lowland rainforests and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
